choices.B: Modify the online voice routing policy.
choices.A: Add the user as a member of a call queue.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer is correct

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment and a Survivable Branch Appliance (SBA) at a site.
You add a new Teams user.
You need to ensure that the user at the site can place and receive PSTN calls in the event of an internet outage.
What should you do?

discussion.content: A single SBC in Calgary with two voice routes (VR1 and VR2). VR1 first priority to route calls to local SBC, VR2 lower priority to route calls to New York SBC.

comments.content: How does a single sbc helps when there is an outtage?

You can deploy a single SBC since the priority is local PSTN egress, but with a need to maintain service availability in case of an SBC outage. In the event of a local SBC failure, the Calgary office can failover to use the SBCs in the New York office. This approach aligns with minimising the number of SBCs while ensuring service continuity.

discussion.content:
New York: A local redundant SBC pair
Calgary: A single SBC

questions.question_text:

Your company has a main office in New York and a branch office in Calgary. All offices connect to each other by using a dedicated WAN.
You have a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment.
You need to recommend a Direct Routing solution that meets the following requirements:
✑ If a Session Border Controller (SBC) fails in the New York office, PSTN services must remain available through a local PSTN egress in New York.
✑ The Calgary office must prioritize a local PSTN egress and ensure that PSTN services remain available in the event of a local SBC outage.
✑ The number of SBCs must be minimized.
What should you recommend for each office? To answer, drag the appropriate components to the correct offices. Each component may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment.
You are deploying a new remote site.
You have a Session Border Controller (SBC) that has an E1/T1 Primary Rate Interface (PRI) deployed to the remote site.
You plan to deploy a Survivable Branch Appliance (SBA) to ensure PSTN connectivity.
Which type of endpoints is supported by the SBA?

choices.C: The failover timer is set to 0 seconds.
choices.D: The firewall blocks traffic on port 5067.
choices.B: Calling plan licenses are not assigned to users.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment.

You are deploying Direct Routing by using a certified Session Border Controller (SBC). The FQDN of the SBC is sbc1.contoso.com. You are signaling port 5067.

You cannot place calls and receive an error message in the Microsoft Teams admin center as shown in the following exhibit.

//IMG//


What is a possible cause of the issue?

You have a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment that uses Direct Routing and two derived trunks named Trunk1 and Trunk2.

Trunk1 experiences an outage.

You need to ensure that Teams will route all calls by using Trunk2.

What should you do?

choices.D: From Operator Connect in the Microsoft Teams admin center, modify the My operators settings.
choices.A: From PowerShell, run the Set-CsOnlinePSTNGateway cmdlet.
choices.B: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, modify the Session Border Controller (SBC) objects.
choices.C: From PowerShell, run the Set-CsOnlineVoiceRoute cmdlet
